description.$t:
I NEED A FOSTER/FUREVER HOME!!!!!!!


 


 


Hi. My name is Lloyd and I am a recovering nipper.  From the time I was just a pup, all the humans I knewdidnât treat me very nicely and the only way I could defend myself was to nip at them. I meant them no harm, but I didnât want them to hurt me anymore, either.


Then the CDR (Chicagoland Dog Rescue) folks took me in.  They figured out super fast that I am really smart, full of energy, a great student and a hard worker. They placed me with a trainer who specializes in cases like mine, and he brags about what great progress Iâve made.


 According to him, I am a Rottweiler mix, about 2-3 years old and I weigh about 55 pounds. My ideal home would be with someone who has experience with a high-energy dog whoâs still working on getting his trust and confidence back to where they should be.


 It would be great if I could be the only dog in the house, âcause that way my master and I could work really hard together to make CDR and my trainer even more proud of me!




***The ADOPTION FEE for this pet is $250 which includes getting the puppy/dog up to date on rabies, distemper and bordetella vaccines, fecal test and deworming if necessary, heartworm test, spay or neuter (not including pre-surgical bloodwork) and a microchip. Free access to our weekly training classes is also included for the life of the dog, something no other rescue in the area offers.***

Hi, my name is Tia.  I am a very, sweet and loving dog.  I love the humans in my life like no other dog can.  All you have to do is look at the way I look at my foster mom.  I love her and she is the best! I have a lot of energy and must find a home with a fenced yard.  Yards make me happyâ¦I can spend hours out there just walking around and sniffing things.  This is a great way to keep me out of trouble!  I love to play fetch and would make an awesome agility dog with the right training.  
I am a bossy kinda of girl who tends to not listen to younger kids, I steal their food, and jump all over them, so a home with kids under 12 is out for me.  I have a mind of my own and am very smart.  In the past, I had learned how to get away with things but through training, I have learned some great new behaviors.  I am looking for a strong pack leader that will reinforce that training or I will revert back to my old ways. I am also looking for someone who will give me time and understand that Iâm just testing things out and not give up on me! I am crate trained and overall pretty quiet.  I come with training classes that you must attend to keep me on track.
I love going to doggie day care but I am known as a rough player. I had a best friend/foster brother Taz ( a rat terrier) who liked to play that way, so we got along great!   I can also be a couch potato and just be content to lick peanut butter out of my Kong (favorite thing on this earth!) 
I hope to find a home of my own with own people soon...Iâm tired of being the foster dog and not the family dog!
Sadly but patiently waiting for my forever home-Tia

***The ADOPTION FEE for this pet is $250 which includes getting the puppy/dog up to date on rabies, distemper and bordetella vaccines, fecal test and deworming if necessary, heartworm test, spay or neuter (not including pre-surgical bloodwork) and a microchip. Free access to our weekly training classes is also included for the life of the dog, something no other rescue in the area offers.***

*PLEASE NOTE:  We do not adopt out on a first-come/first-serve basis.  Applications are accepted for a dog and then a home check is scheduled.  If there are multiple applications for a dog, after all home checks are done,  the dog is adopted out to the home that is the best fit for that dog.
 
 ******Chicagoland Dog Rescue reserves the right to restrict adoption of a dog to potential adopters who live within a fifty (50) mile radius of Schaumburg, IL *****

Hi my name is Rosie.  I got this name because I am as pretty and sweet as the first rose of summer. I am a 2 year old English Setter weighing in at about 50 pounds. I am crate trained and working on house manners as I spent a lot of time outside. I was an owner give up because they had too many dogs.   Now, I'm looking for a home where I can be an only dog ... I have a lot of energy and love to run, so I would make a great running partner or a big backyard where I could run would be great!   Hope to see you soon at adoptions!
Love ,
Rosie



**The ADOPTION FEE for this pet is $250 which includes getting the puppy/dog up to date on rabies, distemper and bordetella vaccines, fecal test and deworming if necessary, heartworm test, spay or neuter (not including pre-surgical bloodwork) and a microchip. Free access to our weekly training classes is also included for the life of the dog, something no other rescue in the area offers.***

*PLEASE NOTE:  We do not adopt out on a first-come/first-serve basis.  Applications are accepted for a dog and then a home check is scheduled.  If there are multiple applications for a dog, after all home checks are done,  the dog is adopted out to the home that is the best fit for that dog.
 
 ******Chicagoland Dog Rescue reserves the right to restrict adoption of a dog to potential adopters who live within a fifty (50) mile radius of Schaumburg, IL *****

Hi Iâm Jake! Iâm a 35 lb lab mix who is 1 year old and Iâm your dream puppy! Iâm one happy dog who will fit in perfectly with your family. Iâm super energetic, playful, and overtly friendly to other humans and doggies. I enjoy kisses and snuggles, and love dog toys! I know my name and Iâm a good listener. Iâm calm on walks and enjoy lots of company. I was an owner give-up at 9 months and spent 3 months in a shelter. Please adopt me, Iâve been waiting for a family! 


**The ADOPTION FEE for this pet is $250 which includes getting the puppy/dog up to date on rabies, distemper and bordetella vaccines, fecal test and deworming if necessary, heartworm test, spay or neuter (not including pre-surgical bloodwork) and a microchip. Free access to our weekly training classes is also included for the life of the dog, something no other rescue in the area offers.***

*PLEASE NOTE:  We do not adopt out on a first-come/first-serve basis.  Applications are accepted for a dog and then a home check is scheduled.  If there are multiple applications for a dog, after all home checks are done,  the dog is adopted out to the home that is the best fit for that dog.
 
 ******Chicagoland Dog Rescue reserves the right to restrict adoption of a dog to potential adopters who live within a fifty (50) mile radius of Schaumburg, IL *****


Hi, my name is Sadie. I find myself in need of a new home since my owner is moving to a smaller place. I am housebroken and donât chew on anything that doesnât belong to me. I am also very loyal, very smart, and affectionate. While I have lived with two other dogs for the last year, I can get unfriendly with them when I feel jealous. A home where I was the only dog on a regular basis would be OK with me! I currently live in a house with doggie dog to a large yard that I really enjoy. Because I am such a large girl, no small children with for me! I have completed my basic training at the CDR training classes and Iâm ready to start my new adventure!
XOXOXO-Sadie

**The ADOPTION FEE for this pet is $250 which includes getting the puppy/dog up to date on rabies, distemper and bordetella vaccines, fecal test and deworming if necessary, heartworm test, spay or neuter (not including pre-surgical bloodwork) and a microchip. Free access to our weekly training classes is also included for the life of the dog, something no other rescue in the area offers.***

This handsome fellow gives hugs.  Stands on his hind legs and puts his front paws on either side of your neck and nuzzles you.  Riley is approximately one year old and  was found in a back yard with a badly infected foot.  

Riley, who is FIV positive, most likely contracted FIV as a result of the deep bite wound.  FIV Cats can live a normal healthy long life if kept inside, fed a healthy diet and given normal routine health care.  I personally had one that lived for over seventeen years and that was just the time I had him.  He lived with a non-FIV cat who never contracted the virus from him.  

Riley is a very affectionate guy who can't seem to get enough pets and love, likes other cats and is working with accepting dogs.  Riley would be a wonderful addition to any family, has lots of energy and would do especially well with kids.    He has had his shots, is neutered, tested and micro chipped.  

Right now Riley is in foster care living with other cats.  You can contact Friendly & Feral Cat Rescue at 847-804-3711 or by emailing Susan Porter at sporter28@comcast.net to arrange for an appointment.

Bruce is a very sweet, affectionate boy that loves to be petted. He is a very calm and quiet cat. He loves to relax in his comfy cat bed. He will roll over in his bed while being petted. Bruce was brought to the adoption center because his owner could no longer care for him. He is waiting for that special someone or family to adopt him.


If you are interested in meeting Bruce, please contact Susan Porter at 847-804-3711 or at sporter28@comcast.net.

Koti is a very affectionate boy that loves attention and pets. He is a very calm cat that likes to relax in his comfy cat bed. He can be a little bit on the shy side. He prefers to be the only cat. He is waiting for someone to take him home and give him lots of love.

If you are interested in meeting Koti, please contact Susan Porter at 847-804-3711 or at sporter28@comcast.net

Elbie is a very affectionate girl that loves attention and pets. At first, she is on the shy side but will come to you for pets. She is a very calm kitty and gets along well with other cats. 

Elbie was taken from a home where her owner could no longer take care of her. She is waiting for someone to take her home and sprinkle her with love. 

If you are interested in meeting this sweet girl, please contact Susan Porter at 847-804-3711 or at sporter28@comcast.net

*PLEASE NOTE:  We do not adopt out on a first-come/first-serve basis.  Applications are accepted for a dog and then a home check is scheduled.  If there are multiple applications for a dog, after all home checks are done,  the dog is adopted out to the home that is the best fit for that dog.
 
 ******Chicagoland Dog Rescue reserves the right to restrict adoption of a dog to potential adopters who live within a fifty (50) mile radius of Schaumburg, IL *****

Hi, my name is Scampers and I am the sweetest Beagle boy you will ever meet!  I was found as a stray and no one came to claim me, so now I am looking for a wonderful new home.  I am dog friendly, kid friendly, crate trained and no accidents for me in there! Iâm not a jumper or barker and respect peopleâs space. I love going for walks and would make an excellent walking buddy.  But, being a beagle, I am all about my nose and if I catch a scent, I will be off and running after it!
Canât wait to meet my new family!!!!
XOXOXO
Scampers



**The ADOPTION FEE for this pet is $250 which includes getting the puppy/dog up to date on rabies, distemper and bordetella vaccines, fecal test and deworming if necessary, heartworm test, spay or neuter (not including pre-surgical bloodwork) and a microchip. Free access to our weekly training classes is also included for the life of the dog, something no other rescue in the area offers.***

*PLEASE NOTE:  We do not adopt out on a first-come/first-serve basis.  Applications are accepted for a dog and then a home check is scheduled.  If there are multiple applications for a dog, after all home checks are done,  the dog is adopted out to the home that is the best fit for that dog.

Hello! My name is Polly and I may be a tiny 10.5 pounds but I am full of SPUNK!  Sometimes, Iâm a bit nervous when I meet new people, but as soon as I realize there is nothing to fear, I want to be friends!  I love going for walks, running around and playing.  I am comfortable in my crate and best of all, Iâm house trained!  I get along great with older kids and other dogs.  In fact, in one of my pictures, you can see me curled up with my foster brother.  My foster family thinks I am an adorable little friend!
Hoping it wonât be long before I find my best friend so I can be a loyal companionâ¦
XOXOXO
Polly



**The ADOPTION FEE for this pet is $250 which includes getting the puppy/dog up to date on rabies, distemper and bordetella vaccines, fecal test and deworming if necessary, heartworm test, spay or neuter (not including pre-surgical bloodwork) and a microchip. Free access to our weekly training classes is also included for the life of the dog, something no other rescue in the area offers.***

Maddie is a cute little girl that loves attention. She is very playful. After playing, she likes to snuggle. She is waiting for someone to take her home. 

If you are interested in meeting Maddie, please contact Susan Porter at 847-804-3711 or at sporter28@comcast.net

Daphne is a very playful little girl. She will sit on your lap after she finishes playing with her brother Oscar (also available for adoption). This adorable girl is waiting for someone to take her home to love. 

If you are interested in meeting Daphne, please contact Susan Porter at 847-804-3711 or at sporter28@comcast.net

Oscar is a very adorable boy that loves to play. You can hold him and snuggle with him. He is waiting for someone to take him home.  He has a sister name Daphne wanting to go home with him.

If you are interested in meeting Oscar, please contact Susan Porter at 847-804-3711 or at sporter28@comcast.net

*PLEASE NOTE:  We do not adopt out on a first-come/first-serve basis.  Applications are accepted for a dog and then a home check is scheduled.  If there are multiple applications for a dog, after all home checks are done, then the dog is adopted out to the home that is the best fit for that dog.
 
 ******Chicagoland Dog Rescue reserves the right to restrict adoption of a dog to potential adopters who live within a fifty (50) mile radius of Schaumburg, IL *****


Hi, my name is Zoe. I am a very pretty 4 year old pittie girl! I found myself in dire straits this Christmas eve when my former family decided they no longer wanted me and posted on social media that someone needed to pick me up or they were going to leave me out in the cold. My foster Mom and Dad swooped in to save me but they already have three dogs and canât keep another one. My foster Mom says Iâm good with other dogs and love to cuddle.
 I am a little shy when first meeting new people but I warm up quickly and then weâre friends! I was a little nervous at the CDR training class with all the dogs barking and strangers around but I settled in quickly and went through several exercise quite well. According to the CDR trainer, I am very smart, eager to please and strong. (She should know, sheâs a trainer!)
 I am looking for someone who is willing to work with me on my basic manners and leash walking skills. A fenced yard will help me burn off my extra energy!
 I would love to find a forever home with a forever familyâ¦.
XOXOXO-Zoe



**The ADOPTION FEE for this pet is $250 which includes getting the puppy/dog up to date on rabies, distemper and bordetella vaccines, fecal test and deworming if necessary, heartworm test, spay or neuter (not including pre-surgical bloodwork) and a microchip. Free access to our weekly training classes is also included for the life of the dog, something no other rescue in the area offers.***

Oreo is a very affectionate boy that loves attention and pets. He is playful and on the adventurous side. He is very lovable and will come to you for attention. He gets along well with other cats. He is waiting for someone to take him home. 

If you are interested in meeting Oreo, please contact Susan Porter at 847-804-3711 or at sporter28@comcast.net.

Savannah was brought to our adoption Center because her family was moving and they could not take her with them. She is an adorable girl with a little feistiness. She wants attention, but is still a little nervous. She is looking for a quiet home with someone to love her. 

If you are interested in meeting Savannah, please contact Susan Porter at 847-804-3711 or at sporter28@comcast.net

Mandy is a very affectionate girl that loves attention and pets. Mandy likes to be held and loves to snuggle. She loves to play with toys.

If you are interested in meeting Mandy, please contact Susan Porter at 847-804-3711 or at sporter28@comcast.net

Reba is a very affectionate girl that loves to be with people. She loves attention and loves to be petted. She likes to relax in her comfy cat bed. 

Reba was adopted out 7 years ago as a kitten and was recently returned to the adoption center because her owners were moving to New York and the wife did not like cats. 

If you are interested in meeting this sweet girl, please contact Susan Porter at 847-804-3711 or at sporter28@comcast.net

breed.$t: Domestic Long Hair - buff and white

description.$t:
Marshmallow is an absolutely adorable and snuggly 5 month-old little girl that was abandoned in a forest preserve in Des Plaines, Illinois.  She is a little shy at first but is very playful and loves to be held.  
 
She is very healthy, spayed, virus tested, up-to-date on all her vaccines, de-wormed, and microchipped.  She also has all of her claws and likes it that way!

If you are interested in meeting Marshmallow, please contact Susan Porter at 847-804-3711 or at sporter28@comcast.net

*PLEASE NOTE:  We do not adopt out on a first-come/first-serve basis.  Applications are accepted for a dog and then a home check is scheduled.  If there are multiple applications for a dog, after all home checks are done,  the dog is adopted out to the home that is the best fit for that dog.
 
 ******Chicagoland Dog Rescue reserves the right to restrict adoption of a dog to potential adopters who live within a fifty (50) mile radius of Schaumburg, IL *****

Hi, my name is Roxy.  I am a sweet, little, and I mean little,  5.5 pound Chihuahua girl.  My family became homeless and either had to find a place for me to stay or give up the shelter they were able to find.  My family is sad to see me go but want me to find a great new home so I wonât have to be bounced around anymore!  Iâm a little scared of things right now since there have been so many changes in my life.  But my foster Mom says Iâm sweet and get along well with the other dogs and cat at her house.  If you think I might just be the sweetheart you have been waiting for, please contact CDR.
XOXOXOXO-Roxy



**The ADOPTION FEE for this pet is $250 which includes getting the puppy/dog up to date on rabies, distemper and bordetella vaccines, fecal test and deworming if necessary, heartworm test, spay or neuter (not including pre-surgical bloodwork) and a microchip. Free access to our weekly training classes is also included for the life of the dog, something no other rescue in the area offers.***

My name is THELMA.

I was brought into CACC with my soul sister Louise.  I'm just a puppy and I can't wait to get into my foster home.  Looking to drive in my future and forever home.  Is it yours?!  

Want to meet me ?!  Visit www.peaceforpits.org and fill out an application for me today

Nigel is a large, friendly male cat about 6 years old. Even with his large size he is very agile and playful and loves to sit on someone's lap. He gets along well with other animals and would enjoy watching the world go by from your window. He has a video taken at his foster home.
Clover is a wonderful girl!  She was abandoned in an apartment in Chicago.  She is a bit much for small kids.  She likes other cats.

Meet Singer!

PERFECT. That is the word Singer's foster mom uses to describe her. This quiet two year old is not only gorgeous, but also sweet and exceptionally polite! Her foster family jokes that Singer is always on time, has lovely table manners, always says please and thank you, and always remembers to use her indoor voice! Soft, sweet, and tidy, Singer is never one to say no to a good snuggle session, but she is never overbearing with her affection either. She does great with other pets and has been waiting ever so patiently for her forever family to find her! This girl is a real catch! If you would like to make Singer the princess of your castle, please fill out an application today! http://www.waveanimalrescue.org/adopt.htmlIf you are interested in meeting or adopting this cat/kitten, please fill out our application here: http://www.waveanimalrescue.org/adopt.html .
